fields.description:
The Windows installer has a screen that warns about upgrading JIRA. It links to a page on how to upgrade JIRA - [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v4.0.0-Beta4/upgrading.html].

This link 404s, as does the link to 'Install JIRA as a Service' - it tries to link to [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v4.0.0-Beta4/runasservice.html]
fields.summary: Documentation links in Windows installer 404

fields.description:
When merging a project version into another project version, the version history in Jira is deleted. It would be really good to store version history on the All Projects section, in addition to the change history being stored against the issues.

Adding this feature would help us a lot keeping track of the releases. For example, it would be easy to find out what versions has been merged etc. My suggestion is to store the history of the versions in the database. Use the "All projects" -> "Versions" screen to show the history of the versions in a project. For example it could say; Version 1.1 is merged to Version 1.2.
fields.summary: Store version history on the "All projects" section

fields.description:
A user will be unable to install JIRA 4.0 under any directory that already has 61 characters in it.

The file {{AbstractSingleValueCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer$NavigatorConversionResult.class}} in {{atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0-SNAPSHOT-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/searchers/transformer/}} creates a path that is too long for NTFS when there are already 61 characters in the path, see [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(VS.85).aspx].

!http://img.skitch.com/20090909-ctcs694yecgkndxhju2fbn3d9n.jpg!
fields.summary: AbstractSingleValueCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer$NavigatorConversionResult.class and parent directories causes 'name too long' for Win32 NTFS

fields.description:
When a fresh JIRA 4.0 instance is created, and the _Projects_ gadget is added, it doesn't complete loading and shows the grey and white horizontal _barber's pole_:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090909-dyjenp9uqyipgr64k9adqumqmq.jpg!
fields.summary: Project Gadget doesn't load and shows horizontal 'barber's pole' when no projects defined
If a user has "Browse Users" permission, show all the groups users belong to in the user profile

fields.summary: Add Gadget To Directory form doesn't validate URIs

fields.description:
REST endpoints will complain about having form encoded data POSTed to them since servlet filters will have touched the params already meaning the request body has already been parsed.

To fix this we shouldn't POST form encoded data to rest endpoints.  Currently the login gadget is the only thing in JIRA that needs to do this.  Attached a patch to fix this post 4.0.
fields.summary: Introduce a login servlet so the REST endpoint doesn't log jersey warning

fields.description:
Charles tells me that a visit to the Dashboard wants this link at least twice

http://jira.atlassian.com/styles/global.css

The resposne headers are :

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date	Wed, 09 Sep 2009 05:51:58 GMT
Server	Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-ASESSIONID	9z1vji
Content-Type	text/css;charset=UTF-8
Vary	Accept-Encoding
Content-Encoding	gzip
Content-Length	1205

And hence its never cached.  

Charles tells me that this adds aprprox 500 - 700 ms to the page download time.  We should find out why.
fields.summary: Dashboard / Gadgets have linked at least 2 to global.css that is never cached.  On Jac this adds 500ms to the download time

fields.description: WARNING: A servlet POST request, to the URI http://localhost:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/login, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto Dashboard and open the preference dialog for any gadget.
3. Try clicking to open fields with drop down options.

Result:
1. Its not working.
2. Something clicking twice thrice open the dialog ones. Error on page

Message: Can't execute code from a freed script
Line: 4
Char: 129
Code: 0
URI: http://localhost:8080/s/450/1/1.0/_/download/batch/jira.webresources:jira-global/jira.webresources:jira-global.js

Expected:
1. No error, user should able to choose options without any issue.
fields.summary: User can't click on drop downs and select other preference options in IE

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Suppose the current JIRA instance has 2 projects and no category.
3. Create a category and create another project and associate it to that category.
4. View the dashboard. User has a project gadget configured with All projects.

Result:
1. It display all the three project.
2. Open the preferences dialog, user can only see list of 2 previous project under All projects.
3. Category and project associated with category is not there.

Expected:
1. It should give user option to select category or project associated with category
fields.summary: Project gadget is not showing category and project in that category in edit dialog

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Setup JIRA with attached data.
2. Login as user veenu/pass. Create a new dashboard. This data has no user dashboard.
3. Search for some issues. I search on "All Project" and click View_chart. Try to save as filter, error.
4. As I wanted to do testing on fresh data. Stop JIRA and deleted the database files.
5. Started JIRA again and imported the same data file again.
6. Search on some issue and click View_Charts.

Result:
1. For some chart it show that expiry blob message.
2. Clicking on "Save to dashboard" show the dashboard created with previous data
3. I tried deleting indexes and then importing data,it still show same result

Expected:
1. It should only show data relevant to the current data.
fields.summary: JIRA seems to be caching the dashboard information after user has restore data
"Filter Results" gadget should have a checkbox for "Use filter column order"

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. For this bug to reproduce user must have a user dashboard. When user has no dashboard to select in charts dialog the filter saved without any error message.
3. Create a new search and select "All Project" in simple nav.
4. Click View_Chart and enter a filter name to save the query.

Result:
1. User is taken to new screen with error message "{"status-code":"500","message":"query should not be null!"} "

Expected:
1. No error message should be there and filter should get saved without error message.
fields.summary: Trying to save filter in charts dialog fail if search is for all project and user has dashboard in JIRA beside system dashboard

fields.description: It would be very helpful to allow the sorting order to be customized in the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Portlet. Currently the user only has two choices: "Natural" or "Total". Given that JRA-11563 seems to be a complex fix, maybe it would be simpler to just add an option to the portlet configuration to choose a custom sorting order for list/select/multi-select fields.
fields.summary: Allow custom sort order for two-dimensional filter statistics portlet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18990].
  {panel}

Hello,

a JIRA instance is installed and used for some time with internal user management. Later on, it is integrated with Crowd and during an upgrade, integrity violations are reported by the checker, users appear as duplicates, etc...

This is caused by having used - at some previous stage - in osuser.xml configuration both internal and Crowd providers.

JIRA could log or refuse to startup until the configuration is fixed and only one such provider is selected.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: JIRA could throw an Error on multiple providers configured in osuser.xml

fields.description:
My instance of Jira currently manages ~80 projects.  Project roles are used extensively for permission schemes in these projects, and default project role membership is set by using user groups.  When the membership of one of those groups changes, it does not cascade retroactively into pre-existing projects (and should not according to docs).

There should be a method of force-sync or force-refresh, however.  I don't create many new projects, but I do change group membership (both add and subtract) somewhat regularly; administering the addition of 1 user to ~80 projects by method of manually adding that user to each project is quite cumbersome.

I'm suggesting that a method exist for a single project, as well as a global method to refresh all project roles in all projects from the default membership assigned in the project role browser.
fields.summary: Allow single and/or global project's role membership to be refreshed on-demand from default membership assignments

fields.description:
When creating a component for a project, it is not possible to manage multiple versions for this component. Instead, versions can only be created project-wide.

Example:
Component A exists in versions 1.0.1, 1.0.2
Component B exists in verstion 3.2
Component C exists in versions 1.6.2, 2.0

This issue was also commented here:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12241?focusedCommentId=150002&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_150002
fields.summary: Managing multiple versions of a component

fields.description:
See [attached log file|^output.log]. The errors were generated when I try to add a custom field provided by the Charting Plugin. 

Can be reproduced with [1.5-beta7 of the Charting Plugin|http://maven.atlassian.com/contrib/com/atlassian/jira/ext/charting/jira-charting-plugin/1.5-beta7/jira-charting-plugin-1.5-beta7.jar] and JIRA 4.0.0-Beta4.

fields.description:
It is possible to create/edit priorites, resolutions and issue types such that they have the same name (but differ in case only).

# Create a Priority.
# Edit the priority. Change its name to that of another priority that only differs in case. 
# Save the priority.

You will now have two priorities of the same name.
fields.summary: Possible create priorities, resolutions and issues types with same name but different case.

The SAL service runner throws the following:

{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginSchedulerService.run(JiraPluginSchedulerService.java:51)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61)

fields.description:
The _Mail Servers_ configuration page allows for an incorrect value to be used for the TCP destination port of a SMTP server.

!http://img.skitch.com/20090905-mbjurdsdfjmj2k3q53fb1w4pna.jpg!

According to [RFC-793|http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc793.html], the destination port field is 16 bits and two's complement; thus the maximum value is (2^16)-1 = 65535. JIRA allows the SMTP destination port to be set to 65536, which causes the following exception:

{noformat}
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: port out of range:65536
	at java.net.InetSocketAddress.<init>(InetSocketAddress.java:118)
	at com.sun.mail.util.SocketFetcher.createSocket(SocketFetcher.java:231)

fields.summary: Mail Servers configuration allows for incorrect TCP port value

fields.description:
In the _Look and Feel Configuration_ page, the _Logo Width_ and _Logo Height_ can be set to negative values:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090905-nh9hxemwx3a6h8sagyd2bmcb5d.jpg!
fields.summary: Look and Feel configuration allows for inappropriate values for Image Width and Image Height

fields.description:
JIRA logs these errors to standard error ([^stderr.txt]) and jira log ([^jira.txt]) when a client drops a connection to Jersey. For example, this occurs if someone navigates away from the dashboard before it has had a chance to finish loading.

We probably should make sure that we don't log these error messages as they just clog up the logs.
fields.summary: JIRA logs lots of stack traces

fields.description: Log in gadget shows content and loading bar at the beginning.

fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.event.ListenerException thrown after accepting default values in JIRA Setup, before setting administrator credentials

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Create a new search and click View_Charts. Try to close the dialog by clicking ESC key.
3. It closes the chart dialog.
4. Now open the charts dialog again. Try to close it with clicking ESC again

Result:
1. Nothing happens.

Expected:
1. ESC should always work for closing the charts.
fields.summary: User can dismiss the charts dialog by clicking ESC key only once in search session

fields.description:
The Issue Statistics gadget lack consistent styling with the 3.13 Project Statistics portlet; the bar graph element is underneath the text describing what it represents, instead of being aligned in the middle like the old one. A large portion of screen space is wasted because of the poor element arrangement.

h5.3.13
!http://img.skitch.com/20090908-bbjn1pfdxkcp55pjd2cip1jta2.jpg!

h5.4.0
!http://img.skitch.com/20090908-tm6w17fssu8fiw5h78pbqb92cr.jpg!
fields.summary: Issue Statistics Gadget bar graphs not inline

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Find some issues on some search criteria.
3. Save the filter as say X
4. Now click "New" and search in issue navigator for issues. Click View_charts and click "Save to Dashboard"
5. Enter X as the name of filter.

Result:
1. It save the filter without any error message.
2. Again trying to create the filter with same name give error message.

Expected:
1. User should n't be allowed to save filter with existing name.
fields.summary: User can create a filter with existing name through charts dialog.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Start the JIRA and in setup screen,try to restore data.
2. Put a version 2 maintenance expired license and click ok

Result:
1. JIRA fails with java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager$2.get(JiraDashboardStateStoreManager.java:106)

Expected:
1. Proper message should be there that the maintenance for the license is expired.
fields.summary: JIRA fails with "java.lang.NullPointerException" if user try to put a maintenance expired license while restoring data

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Upgrade JIRa 4.0 with customer data from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39167
2. Login as admin/sphere.
3. On the dashboard, click on filter "All Open Issues, All Projects, All status" used in a pie chart.

Result:
1. It show user 847 issues in JIRA 4.0 and 734 issue in 3.13.5
2. Investigation shows that user has two status defined with same name "In Progress (Services)" and they are used in different workflows.
3. JIRA 4.0 is searching for issues with the second "In Progress (Services)".

Expected:
1. Correct queries should be run.

fields.description:
When creating an issue, the Component select box contains "Unknown" as well as a set of components.  Today I found myself creating an issue against a project with which I'm unfamiliar, so I selected "Unknown" because I didn't know, and one of the components I thought might be relevant.

When I submitted the form I was told:

{panel:bgColor=#fcc}{color:red}*You cannot select "Unknown" with a specific component*{color}{panel}

I was also told that I had to reattach my attachments, which was pretty annoying.

If I'm not allowed to select "Unknown" and a specific component, then don't let me do it, or at least instruct me near the box that I'm not allowed to do it.  I'd be happier if the system just threw the "Unknown" away if it has no meaning.  

(I guess I would be less annoyed by this if the uploaded files weren't thrown away, see [JRA-16335])
fields.summary: Information that I can't select "unknown" and a specific component is given too late

fields.description: See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-1825 - XML views of issues and filter results do not specify character encoding, as per XML standard. This blows up XML parsers in remote client code (such as PaZu) which expect UTF-8 and sometimes receive national characters (e.g. Latin1).
fields.summary: XML views of issues and filter results do not specify character encodings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18919].
  {panel}

Hello all,

please consider the following scenario:
# JIRA is deployed standalone and users and groups are created in the internal database
# filters are shared - among groups, in particular and subscriptions to these are enabled
# JIRA is then subsequently integrated with Crowd and some of these groups are lost in the process
# the integrity checker will report the following message rather than correctly identify a subscription to a filter shared with a non-existent group:  
{noformat}
Subscription filter with id #### is missing its corresponding saved filter and will be removed
{noformat}

It would be desirable if the integrity checker would: 
# check for filters shared to non existing users/groups
# perform more context as to why the filter is now missing and should be removed


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Integrity checker could manage subscripton permission revocation more clearly

Instant messaging is great for quick answers and responses, currently if I need quick response I use instant messaging, JIRA is usually too "slow". Bad side of using instant messaging is that conversation is not stored in JIRA...

I am thinking about solution when task could be turned in messaging mode, then you could see who is loged in JIRA, invite people to conversation about task, see who is currently typing and all conversation would be stored on task as comments.

fields.description:
If a gadget works in both authorised and anonymous mode, upon adding a new gadget to an external container, the user is prompted with a message that offers to initiated the three-legged OAuth process.

Problem is, this only happens after the first REST call, often a filter/project picker request after the user has already started picking a filter or project and configuring the gadget. 

Ideally the gadget would suggest the OAuth option before the user has started configuring the gadget..
fields.summary: Gadget OAuth check is only initiated after first REST call is made (klunky)

Result:
1. User is taken to Dashboard and the gadget is there with relevant data.
2. But clicking on Issues drop down, still show unsaved filter(issue#).

Expected:
1. Saved filter name should be there as it happen when user save any filter.
fields.summary: Filter saved inside charts dialog in "issue navigator" , doesn't show up in issues tab

fields.description:
The getNamifiedQuery() method in the JQL Upgrade Task should be more paranoid about exceptions generated by the code (specifically the generation of the SearchContext).

If any Exceptions are encountered, simply return the pre-namified Query. After all, namifying is a nicety!

(This came up due to an issue when upgrading QA-SAC data, but the environment was not entirely complete/defined.)
fields.summary: Make JQL Upgrade Task namifying more exception paranoid

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA. I am using customer data https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-35690
2. Login as "alis" and view filter MaltaGo -Open Issues in dashboard

Result:
1. It show user the valid result which is same as 3.13.5
2. Click to view the actual query.
3. User is taken to advanced view with query "project = CER AND issuetype = Problem AND cf[10015] in (Go-Mobile, Maltacom) AND assignee = crmjiramanager AND status = Open ORDER BY priority DESC, key DESC" and error message "The option 'Go-Mobile' for field 'cf[10015]' does not exist"
4. We are doing fine job of telling customer which option is not valid but why we are showing custom field with id. In scenario's where the filter is error free , we show name of custom field.

Expected:
1. The ID of custom field should be replaced with actual name.
fields.summary: JQL should show the name of custom field in case where some of the option in custom field is not available

fields.description:
I am experiencing the following behaviour:

*If context path is set to "" in server.xml*
* When deleting a project avatar, the request goes to http://localhost:8090/secure/popups/AvatarPicker!default.jspa?pid=10001. This page returns a popup decorated page with no contents. This page does include AJS however. As this page returns with a 200 response the avatar control adds it to the DOM. Appending it to the DOM causes the AJS to be executed again. AJS adds and additional blanket (grayed out background) to the body. This means that when we try and close the dialog we are only removing a single blanket.

*If context path is set to "/" in server.xml*
* Same behviour as above
* Cannot click on "Edit Project" or "Add Project". This is because the urls are written as "//secure/...".
fields.summary: Setting an empty or "/" context path cause strange things to happen for Edit Project
